title: A birthday present from a friend.
body:
I thought this was really cute, and I realized I hadn't yet posted it.

I'm shown in the lower right corner. I have no idea who those other two people are.

replies.body:
> D'awww!

I know! Such an adorable cupcake. If only those two yordles would stop smiling, and think about how hungry they are, and how delicious I look. Why, they could just snatch me right up! Haha! What a delicious and (most importantly) safe snack I am, and how utterly different from (random example) a steel-jawed clap-trap that triggers at the slightest touch.

BTW, which **[faction](http://LeagueFactions.net)** are you thinking of joining this round? I saw your post in that thread and got all excited.

> > D'awww!
> 
> I know! Such an adorable cupcake. If only those two yordles would stop smiling, and think about how hungry they are, and how delicious I look. Why, they could just snatch me right up! Haha! What a delicious and (most importantly) safe snack I am, and how utterly different from (random example) a steel-jawed clap-trap that triggers at the slightest touch.
> 
> BTW, which **[faction](http://LeagueFactions.net)** are you thinking of joining this round? I saw your post in that thread and got all excited.

/goes to give you a hug --- WAIT A MINUTE.

I'm still deciding. I'm thinking Bilgewater or Freljord.

> /goes to give you a hug --- WAIT A MINUTE.

Awww. But wouldn't a cupcake be just the pick-me-up you need on a Tuesday morning? Look at all this thick frosting. Gosh! I could eat myself right up! Haha! Just ***COME CLOSER.*** I mean, heehee, come closer!

{{champion:51}} The talking ones just really aren't an improvement.
 
> I'm still deciding. I'm thinking Bilgewater or Freljord.

Try not to let Nami tell **[one of her adorable anecdotes.](http://leaguefactions.net/nyroth-update-3-not-your-hero/)** She suckers in a lot of people with those.

Bilgewater's been dominant all arc, somewhat surprisingly. The Freljord (which has been trailing them in second place for most of the arc) gave them their first defeat in a set of weekend Featured Matches this past Sunday, winning 2–1. It was quite the upset.

Freljord strategy summarized:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Iy4Pg1GRT2c

They won the very first Factions arc. There was a fantastic moment that sticks in my mind: the entire opposing team multiply slowed, trying to drag themselves out of a Nunu/Anivia ult. One of them makes it, whereupon Volibear bounds after them and chucks them back into the ult-circle of doom. It was beautiful.

Then again, Ionia took second place in the first tournament a couple weeks back, and their teams have really been drilling. Dashes and hypercarries everywhere.

As for the Shadow Isles, uh, that's a faction for people who want a challenge. (Kalista was not the massive power boost people thought she'd be.)

> > /goes to give you a hug --- WAIT A MINUTE.
> 
> Awww. But wouldn't a cupcake be just the pick-me-up you need on a Tuesday morning? Look at all this thick frosting. Gosh! I could eat myself right up! Haha! Just ***COME CLOSER.*** I mean, heehee, come closer!
> 
> {{champion:51}} The talking ones just really aren't an improvement.
>  
> > I'm still deciding. I'm thinking Bilgewater or Freljord.
> 
> Try not to let Nami tell **[one of her adorable anecdotes.](http://leaguefactions.net/nyroth-update-3-not-your-hero/)** She suckers in a lot of people with those.
> 
> Bilgewater's been dominant all arc, somewhat surprisingly. The Freljord (which has been trailing them in second place for most of the arc) gave them their first defeat in a set of weekend Featured Matches this past Sunday, winning 2–1. It was quite the upset.
> 
> Freljord strategy summarized:
> 
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Iy4Pg1GRT2c
> 
> They won the very first Factions arc. There was a fantastic moment that sticks in my mind: the entire opposing team multiply slowed, trying to drag themselves out of a Nunu/Anivia ult. One of them makes it, whereupon Volibear bounds after them and chucks them back into the ult-circle of doom. It was beautiful.
> 
> Then again, Ionia took second place in the first tournament a couple weeks back, and their teams have really been drilling. Dashes and hypercarries everywhere.
> 
> As for the Shadow Isles, uh, that's a faction for people who want a challenge. (Kalista was not the massive power boost people thought she'd be.)

Frosting, you say? /reaches hand out --- That trap looks awfully sharp. You sure it's not going to close on me?

Also, Nami's my main fish, so Bilgewater it is for me! Consider me signed up! :D
